languageKey.label: A digital asset you would like to make available along with a sermon.

A sermon resource is typically a digital asset, either uploaded directly into the resource record or accessed from another website via a web address (URL). A resource may also be another plug-in that you associate with a sermon record.
The language of this resource.
This should be the default language unless this resource represents a translation of another language.
Hides this record from Front End display.
This checkbox will hide or unhide a resource from the users of your site. You can use this to temporarily hide this record from the Front End while editing it in the Back End.
tx_wecsermons_resources:starttime,tx_wecsermons_resources:endtime,tx_wecsermons_resources:fe_group,tx_wecsermons_resources:islinked
The date this record will be shown on the Front End.
Start is the date that the resource will first be available to your users. This will be 12:00 am, midnight, on the date specified.
tx_wecsermons_resources:hidden,tx_wecsermons_resources:endtime,tx_wecsermons_resources:fe_group,tx_wecsermons_resources:islinked
The date this record will no longer be shown on the Front End.
Stop is the date that the resource will no longer be shown on the website. This will be at 12:00 am, midnight, on the date specified.
tx_wecsermons_resources:hidden,tx_wecsermons_resources:starttime,tx_wecsermons_resources:fe_group,tx_wecsermons_resources:islinked
Only members of the user group specified here will see this resource.

Access specifies what user groups are allowed to see this resource. If a user group is selected, this resource will only be visible by those users who log into the Front End and are members of the specified user group.
tx_wecsermons_resources:hidden,tx_wecsermons_resources:starttime,tx_wecsermons_resources:endtime,tx_wecsermons_resources:islinked
Enables or disables linking to the single view of this record on the Front End.

This checkbox allows you to have a resource entered into the SMS and displayed on the Front End, but disallow users to access the resources by disabling the link to its single view, or disabling the link to the resource itself.
tx_wecsermons_resources:hidden,tx_wecsermons_resources:starttime,tx_wecsermons_resources:endtime,tx_wecsermons_resources:fe_group,tx_wecsermons_resources:islinked
Title of the resource
The title you wish you name this resource with.
The type of resource.

Resource type determines what fields are available for a resource. Available fields are description, icon, file, MIME type, and URL. See resource type definition for details on these fields. Resource types can be defined by "Resource Type" records.
tx_wecsermons_resource_types
The general description given for this resource..
The description can be used to briefly describe the resource.
A digitial image associated with a resource.
A graphic can help describe a resource, or be used in a "graphical link" to the resource itself.
Text used int the Alt and Title attributes of a resource graphic
Alt attributes are displayed in place of the resource graphic if the browser can not display the image, while the title attribute is used as a "tooltip" pop-up.
A file associated with a resource.

A file is typically the ditial asset you wish to provide to the user of the website. This can be anything such as a PDF file, MS Word Document, digital pictures, etc. The only files that can not be made available are .PHP files.
A valid Mime Type.

MIME type is used in the SMS when generating a Podcast. Podcasts are syndicated feeds that can provide access to files. The MIME type is required in the "enclosure" tag of an RSS feed or Podcast, which makes syndicated information and files available.
RSS Specification|http://blogs.law.harvard.edu/tech/rss,Valid MIME Types|http://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/
A web address polnting to an online resource.
The URL can be used to link to a resource that is available on another website, such as streaming audio or streaming video.
